definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Don't be awkward: we have to get this finished by five o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 不要出難題了，我們必須趕五點鐘前把這項工作幹完。

sentences.english: They really put me through the mill in my interview.
sentences.chinese: 他們在面試時實在是給我出難題了。

sentences.english: Why didn't you ask difficult questions just now?
sentences.chinese: 那你們剛纔怎麼不出難題呢？

sentences.english: He tried to work out the problem.
You're always giving me big nuts to crack.
And I thought I would tease you with this one here.
sentences.chinese: 我又要給大家出難題了。

sentences.english: But I guess I like to make things difficult on myself, because I do that all the time.
sentences.chinese: 但我猜我喜歡給自己出難題，因爲我一直這樣做。

sentences.english: She know how to score off people who ask difficult question.
sentences.chinese: 她很會讓那些給她出難題的人自討沒趣。

sentences.english: I hope the professor doesn't throw us any curveballs on the test.
sentences.chinese: 我希望教授考試的時候別給我們出難題。

sentences.english: Nationals to calm, to mutual understanding, not a problem to the Government.
sentences.chinese: 國民要冷靜，要相互理解，不要給政府出難題。
